channel.title: Free and Easy to Use Firewall - Comodo
channel.description:
Free and Easy to Use Firewall - Comodo
Anyone looking for a free firewall? This is supposed to be the best one! :) http://www.personalfirewall.comodo.com/
Here are some screenshots. http://www.personalfirewall.comodo.com/screenshots.html
~Ron :D

item.title: Free and Easy to Use Firewall - Comodo
item.dc:creator: @nator123123 nator123123
item.description:
@nator123123 wrote:

[quote=“Ron, post:12, topic:102008”]Thank you for the wonderful comments. In case any one is curious, here are 2 more free firewalls for windows xp/vista.

Arovax Shield - Free - 1.91 MB
Here is Softpedia’s Editor Review for the App.

Active Wall Free Edition - Free - 2.59 MB

Enjoy! :)[/quote]
Ron, The active wall gave my PC the blue screen of death when I installed and uninstalled.
This is a danger program to me. I don’t think it installs correct drivers, or it uninstalls the incorrect drivers, or uninstalls them incorrectly.
I still haven’t fixed the blue screen of death, so people don’t install it-_-

Read full topic
item.source: Free and Easy to Use Firewall - Comodo

xxhellfirexx, just to clarify certain things, those reviews are a year old and Arovax Shield has gotten much better.

Read full topic
item.source: Free and Easy to Use Firewall - Comodo

item.title: Free and Easy to Use Firewall - Comodo
item.dc:creator: @xxhellfirexx xxhellfirexx
item.description:
@xxhellfirexx wrote:

[quote=“Ron, post:12, topic:102008”]Arovax Shield - Free - 1.91 MB
Here is Softpedia’s Editor Review for the App.[/quote]

Warning to everyone before downloading this program that it does make registry changes that are hard to change back.

*  May 27, 2006
* For version:
* 1.2.348

quote Heads up! quote

* Interface: 3
* Features: 3
* Ease of use: 2
* Value: 3
* Overall: 2

I was pleased with this program’s performance initially. I installed a new internet explorer and could not get arovaxshield to allow the browser to go directly to my homepage vs. the run once introductory page of the explorer. I un-installed arovaxshield and re-booted. That’s when I discovered the uninstallation process disabled my firewall, my anti-virus protection and also administrative priviledges. This prevented me from activating the firewall or the AV protection. I found some other undesirable registry changes as well. In short if you put this baby on you system, you need to know how to remove it without making some uninvited changes in your start up process.

user Review by: AungDin (55)
Read all 55 reviews by AungDin

* May 17, 2006
* For version:
* 1.2.348

quote Not quite perfect yet quote

* Interface: 2
* Features: 2
* Ease of use: 3
* Value: 1
* Overall: 2

The program does what it says but there are some bugs. If you set it to ask you on detection, it does ask you if you want to block or allow the program but once you click on allow/block, the program resets itself back to the “Don’t ask me option”, so from then on it will block everything without asking. I also found out that after uninstalling, it wipes out your start-up files and had to use Windows XP-system restore to go back in time before I installed Arovax Shield. I also did not find a “Restore Option” if you block a program and find out later that it was not harmful to your pc.

user Review by: SNAKEPLISKEN

Taken from http://www.snapfiles.com/opinions/ArovaxShield/ArovaxShield.html

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Ron:

Linux does not even need a firewall.

If you’re going to post in a tone that suggests other people don’t know what they’re talking about, at least make sure what you’re saying isn’t stupid.

item.title: Free and Easy to Use Firewall - Comodo
item.dc:creator: @kmb Kmb
item.description:
@kmb wrote:

[quote=“Ron, post:3, topic:102008”]Anyone who uses Linux knows about Firestarter and Linux does not even need a firewall. :rolleyes: So it’s not really worth mentioning.

The firewall I was describing, Comodo, is for Windows.[/quote]

Well, I use linux and I haven’t heard of FireStarter before. I’m using configured iptables.

Like three-four years ago I was looking for a free windows firewall, and I ran into this… Or was in Tiny Personal Firewall? Can’t be too sure.

Anyways, this looks good

Read full topic
